meanings.definition: A person who sells cheap or inferior goods.
meanings.sent1: The cheapjacks at the market offered low-quality items at affordable prices.
meanings.sent2: I bought a toy from the cheapjacks on the street corner.
meanings.sent3: The cheapjacks tried to sell me a broken watch as a collector's item!
meanings.sent4: The street was filled with cheapjacks shouting about their wares like carnival barkers.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cheapjacks hawking their goods stayed with me long after I left the market.

meanings.definition: A stall or stand where cheap goods are sold.
meanings.sent1: The cheapjacks set up their colorful stalls at the fairground.
meanings.sent2: We found some unique souvenirs at the cheapjacks' stand.
meanings.sent3: The cheapjacks' stall collapsed in the wind, scattering goods everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The rows of cheapjacks' stands stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The smell of popcorn mixed with the sights and sounds of the cheapjacks' stalls at the carnival.

meanings.definition: To sell cheap or inferior goods.
meanings.sent1: He decided to cheapjacks his old furniture to make some quick cash.
meanings.sent2: The street vendors cheapjacks their products to tourists looking for bargains.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly accused her friend of trying to cheapjacks her with a fake designer bag.
meanings.sent4: The company's reputation suffered when they were caught trying to cheapjacks faulty electronics.
meanings.sent5: The salesman's attempt to cheapjacks the outdated technology failed miserably.
